member.name: T:BizUnit.TestSteps.BizTalk.Map.ExecuteMapStep
member.summary: The ExecuteMapStep can be used to execute a map and test the output from it
member.remarks:
The following shows an example of the Xml representation of this test step.
.\TestData\Schema1.xml .\TestData\Schema2.actual.xml
/def:html/def:body/def:p[2]/def:form /def:html/def:body/def:p[2]/def:form/def:input[3] /def:html/def:body/def:p[2]/def:form/def:input[4] /def:html/def:body/def:p[2]/def:form/def:input[2]
.\TestData\PurchaseOrder.xsd http://SendMail.PurchaseOrder
PONumber_0
Map:assemblyPath The assembly containing the BizTalk map to execute.
Map:typeName The typename of the BizTalk map to execute
Source The relative file location of the input document to be mapped
Destination The relative file location of the ouput document that has been mapped
ContextLoaderStep The configuration for the context loader step used to load data into the BizUnit context which may be used by subsequent test steps
(optional)
ValidationStep The configuration for the validation step used to validate the contents of the file, the validation step should implement IValidationTestStep
(optional)

member.summary: ITestStep.Execute() implementation

member.remarks:

5 BizUnitTest.Process BizUnitTest.Process.SubmitToLedger Start
Tag Description
DelayForCompletion The delay before executing the step
(optional)
AssemblyName The name of the assembly containing the orchestration, e.g. BizUnitTest.Process
OrchestrationName The name of the orchestration to start/stop
Action Start|Stop

member.name: T:BizUnit.TestSteps.BizTalk.Host.HostConductorStep
member.summary: The HostConductorStep test step maybe used to start or stop a BizTalk host
member.remarks:
The following shows an example of the Xml representation of this test step.
start|stop BizTalkServerApplication RecvHost zeus\\administrator appollo*1 true
Tag Description
HostInstanceName The name of the host instance to start|stop
Action A value of start or stop
(start|stop)
Server The server(s) where the Biztalk host instance is running, a commer delimeted list of servers may be supplied (optional)
Logon String containing the logon information used by the host instance (optional - unless Server is supplied)
PassWord String containing the password for the host (optional - unless Logon is supplied)
GrantLogOnAsService (optional - unless Logon is supplied) Boolean determining whether the 'Log On As Service' privilege should be automatically granted to the specified logon user or not. This flag only has effect when the HostType property is set to In-process

member.name: T:BizUnit.TestSteps.BizTalk.Pipeline.ExecuteSendPipelineStep
member.summary: The ExecuteReceivePipelineStep can be used to execute a pipeline and test the output from it
member.remarks:
The following shows an example of the Xml representation of this test step. The step can perform a pipeline and output that to an output file
Pipeline:assemblyPath The assembly containing the BizTalk pipeline to execute.
Pipeline:typeName The typename of the BizTalk pipeline to execute
DocSpecs:assembly The assembly containing the BizTalk docspec schema assembly path (multiple)
DocSpecs:type The assembly containing the BizTalk docspec schema type name (multiple)
SourceDir The directory path for the source input file(s) to execute in the pipeline
SearchPattern The search pattern for the input files. E.g. input*.xml
Destination The destination to write the pipeline output file
InputContextDir The directory path for the source context file(s) (optional)
InputContextSearchPattern The search pattern for the source context file(s) (optional)
OutputContextFile The location to write the output message context file (optional)
SourceEncoding The charset to be written on the pipeline input message (optional)

member.name: T:BizUnit.TestSteps.BizTalk.Pipeline.ExecuteReceivePipelineStep

Pipeline:assemblyPath The assembly containing the BizTalk pipeline to execute.

DocSpecs:assembly The assembly containing the BizTalk docspec schema assembly path (multiple)

Source The file path of the source input file to execute in the pipeline
Source:Encoding The excoding type of the input file to execute in the pipeline
DestinationDir The destination directory to write the pipeline output file(s)
DestinationFileFormat The file format of the output file(s)
ContextFileFormat The file format of the output message context file(s)

member.name: T:BizUnit.TestSteps.BizTalk.Port.ReceiveLocationEnabledStep
member.summary: The ReceiveLocationEnabledStep test step checks to determine whether a specific receive location is enabled or disabled.
member.remarks:
The following shows an example of the Xml representation of this test step.
GovenorIn true
Tag Description
ReceiveLocationName The name of the receive location to check
IsDisabled If true is specified then the test step will check to see that the receive location is disabled, if false, the step will check it is enabled
